info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 10:36PM EDT until July 20 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of central Maryland, including the following counties, Montgomery and Prince Georges.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockville... Bowie... College Park... Greenbelt... Beltsville... Aspen Hill... Potomac... North Bethesda... Fairland... White Oak... Adelphi... Colesville... Kemp Mill... Mitchellville... North Kensington... South Kensington... Forest Glen... Hillandale... Wheaton-Glenmont... Goddard... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SUNDAY
